entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/12. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F06: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/12. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-02-12

entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, popularity of politicians, evaluation of Prime Minister candidates, evaluating the work of the government and opposition 2) the success of own life and the country, subjective financial situation, getting ahead in society 3) evaluation of the work and importance of specialized government areas, the reputation and evaluation of the educational policy of the government, looking for information regarding education, media consumption 4) knowledge about the pension contribution system, evaluation of the working of the several-pillar pension system, trust in the private pension funds, factors of leaving a private pension fund 5) eating habits and opportunities on weekdays, opinions of regular warm food, money and time spent on lunch, the meal support ofthe workplace, evaluation of the meal support 6) preferred channels for selling cars
entry.dcterms:subject: mass political behavior, attitudes
social conditions and indicators
labour and employment
political institutions, public administration
economic conditions and indicators
health condition
social behaviour and attitudes
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
A
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
